titleStmt.title: TO THE KIND ACCEPTANCE of his louing Kinsman William Martyn of the middle Temple, Gent.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: TO THE KIND ACCEPTANCE of his louing Kinsman William Martyn of the middle Temple, Gent.

monogr.title: Nevv epigrams, and a satyre. VVritten by Ios: Martyn, a wel-wisher to study
monogr.author: Martyn, Joseph

div.head: TO THE KIND ACCEPTANCE of his louing Kinsman William Martyn of the middle Temple, Gent.

lg.head: The Authors Apologie for his Satyre.
lg.l: IF any aske, how I, so young, so raw,
Durst fasten on this head-strong Time a Iaw,
How I, (that scarce can speak) should dare to write:
And that a Satyre too, (in times dispite)
I answere; Loue to Vertue (quite defac'd)
And hate to Vice, (that in her roome is plac'd).
Then call me Child, or Foole, or both, I care not,
They both doe tell the truth, when wiser dare not
